usefulItems: jug, ladle, pancake pan or frying pan, hob
title: Pudla with Spinach and Paneer

ingredients.content: 1 small handful fresh coriander leaves (approx. 5 g)
2 spring onions, cut in pieces (2 cm)
15 g fresh root ginger, peeled, cut in round slices (2 mm)
30 g vegetable oil, plus 2 tsp for frying
150 g paneer cheese, cut in pieces
½ tsp fine sea salt, or to taste

preparations.content: Place coriander, spring onions and ginger in mixing bowl then chop <b>3 sec/speed 7<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula then chop again <b>3 sec/speed 7<b>.
Place a jug on mixing bowl lid. Weigh in water then set jug aside.

Add chickpea flour, salt, cumin and turmeric to mixing bowl then, without measuring cup, mix <b>1 min/speed 3<b> while slowly adding water through hole in mixing bowl lid. Scrape down sides and base of mixing bowl with spatula. Mix again <b>10 sec/speed 4<b>. Transfer to a bowl and leave to rest for 30 minutes. Meanwhile, clean mixing bowl and make filling.
Place oil and cumin seeds in mixing bowl then fry <b>5 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>.
Add onions and chop <b>5 sec/speed 7<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula then sauté <b>8 min/120°C/speed <b>.
Add cumin, turmeric, chilli powder and nutmeg then fry <b>1 min 30 sec/100°C/speed <b>.

Add garlic, paneer and spinach then chop <b>3 sec/speed 5<b> while stirring with spatula through hole in mixing bowl lid. Cook <b>3 min/100°C/speed <b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add cream and salt then simmer <b>2 min/95°C/speed <b>.

Heat 2 tsp oil in a small non-stick frying pan or pancake pan over a medium heat. Pour a ladleful of pudla batter into pan and spread out a little to form a thick pancake. Cook for 2 minutes until golden then flip over. Cook for a further minute then transfer to a hot plate and keep warm.
Repeat until all batter has been used, adding more oil as necessary. Spoon some hot filling into each pancake, fold over and serve warm.

hintsAndTricks: For a spicy pancake version, add a halved fresh green chilli to batter in step 1.

Pudla are popular Indian chickpea pancakes or crêpes, which we’ve combined here with cheese and spinach for an Indian-French fusion dish! The pancakes are gluten-free and can be eaten as a snack or lunch – you could also serve the pudla alone with dal.
